Vector.name: Vector
Vector.description: A class to describe a two or three dimensional vector. This datatype stores two or three variables that are commonly used as a position, velocity, and/or acceleration. Technically, position is a point and velocity and acceleration are vectors, but this is often simplified to consider all three as vectors. For example, if you consider a rectangle moving across the screen, at any given instant it has a position (the object's location, expressed as a point.), a velocity (the rate at which the object's position changes per time unit, expressed as a vector), and acceleration (the rate at which the object's velocity changes per time unit, expressed as a vector). Since vectors represent groupings of values, we cannot simply use traditional addition/multiplication/etc. Instead, we'll need to do some "vector" math, which is made easy by the methods inside the PVector class.

classitems.description: Used to run a function on all elements of an array. Please note the existance of the convenience methods b.stories(), b.paragraphs(), b.lines(), b.words() and b.characters() that are used to iterate through all instances of the given type in the given document.
classitems.name: forEach

params.name: cb
params.description: The function that will be called on each element. The call will be like function(item,i) where i is the current index of the item within the array.

classitems.description:
Suspends the calling thread for a number of milliseconds.
During a sleep period, checks at 100 millisecond intervals to see whether the sleep should be terminated.
classitems.name: delay

classitems.description: Calls the given callback function with each story of the given document.
classitems.name: stories

params.name: doc
params.description: The document instance to iterate the stories in

params.name: cb
params.description: The callback function to call with each story. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: story, loopCount;

classitems.description: Calls the given callback function with each paragraph of the given document, story or text frame.
classitems.name: paragraphs

params.name: item
params.description: The story or text frame instance to iterate the paragraphs in

params.name: cb
params.description: The callback function to call with each paragraph. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: para, loopCount

params.name: item

The document, story, text frame or paragraph instance to
                                                  iterate the lines in

params.name: item
params.description:
The document, story, text frame, paragraph or line instance
                                                       to iterate the words in

params.name: cb

classitems.description: Calls the given callback function with each character of the given document, story, text frame, paragraph, line or word.

params.name: item

The document, story, text frame, paragraph, line or word instance to

classitems.description:
Sets or possibly creates the current document and returns it.
If the param doc is not given the current document gets set to the active document
in the application. If no document at all is open, a new document gets created.
classitems.name: doc

params.name: doc
params.description: The document to set the current document to

classitems.description: Closes the current document.

params.name: file
params.description: The indesign file instance to save the document to

classitems.description: Returns the current page and sets it if argument page is given.

params.name: page
params.description: The page or page index to set the current page to

classitems.description: Returns the current layer and sets it if argument layer is given.
classitems.name: layer

params.name: layer
params.description: The layer or layer name to set the current layer to

classitems.description: Sets the units of the document (like right clicking the rulers).
classitems.name: units

params.name: units
params.description: Supported units: PT, PX, CM, MM or IN

classitems.description: Creates a vertical guide line at the current spread and current layer.

classitems.description: Creates a horizontal guide line at the current spread and current layer.

JSON.encode()

params.name: Object
params.description: to be converted to a JSON-string

classitems.description:
Converts a byte, char, int, or color to a String containing the
equivalent binary notation. For example color(0, 102, 153, 255) 
will convert to the String "11111111000000000110011010011001". This 
function can help make your geeky debugging sessions much happier.
classitems.name: binary

classitems.description:
Converts a String representation of a binary number to its 
equivalent integer value. For example, unbinary("00001000") will 
return 8.
classitems.name: unbinary

classitems.description: Convert a number to a hex representation.
classitems.name: hex

params.name: len
params.description: The length of the hex number to be created, default: 8

return.description: The hex representation as a string

classitems.description: Convert a hex representation to a number.
classitems.name: unhex

classitems.description:
Combines an array of Strings into one String, each separated by 
the character(s) used for the separator parameter. To join arrays 
of ints or floats, it's necessary to first convert them to strings 
using nf() or nfs().
classitems.name: join

classitems.description:
The split() function breaks a string into pieces using a
character or string as the divider. The delim parameter specifies the
character or characters that mark the boundaries between each piece. A
String[] array is returned that contains each of the pieces.

If the result is a set of numbers, you can convert the String[] array
to to a float[] or int[] array using the datatype conversion functions
int() and float() (see example above).

The splitTokens() function works in a similar fashion, except that it
splits using a range of characters instead of a specific character or
sequence.
classitems.name: split

params.name: delim
params.description: The string used to separate the data

classitems.description:
The splitTokens() function splits a String at one or many character 
"tokens." The tokens parameter specifies the character or characters 
to be used as a boundary.

If no tokens character is specified, any whitespace character is used 
to split. Whitespace characters include tab (\t), line feed (\n), 
carriage return (\r), form feed (\f), and space. To convert a String 
to an array of integers or floats, use the datatype conversion functions 
int() and float() to convert the array of Strings.
classitems.name: splitTokens

params.name: tokens
params.description: list of individual characters that will be used as separators

classitems.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. There
are two versions, one for formatting floats and one for formatting
ints. The values for the digits, left, and right parameters should
always be positive integers.

As shown in the above example, nf() is used to add zeros to the
left and/or right of a number. This is typically for aligning a list
of numbers. To remove digits from a floating-point number, use the
int(), ceil(), floor(), or round() functions.
classitems.name: nf

classitems.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. Similar to nf() 
but leaves a blank space in front of positive numbers so they align 
with negative numbers in spite of the minus symbol. There are two 
versions, one for formatting floats and one for formatting ints. The 
values for the digits, left, and right parameters should always be 
positive integers.
classitems.name: nfs

classitems.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. Similar to nf() 
but puts a "+" in front of positive numbers and a "-" in front of 
negative numbers. There are two versions, one for formatting floats 
and one for formatting ints. The values for the digits, left, and right 
parameters should always be positive integers.
classitems.name: nfp

classitems.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings and placing 
appropriate commas to mark units of 1000. There are two versions, one 
for formatting ints and one for formatting an array of ints. The value 
for the digits parameter should always be a positive integer.
classitems.name: nfc

classitems.description:
Removes whitespace characters from the beginning and end of a String. 
In addition to standard whitespace characters such as space, carriage 
return, and tab, this function also removes the Unicode "nbsp" character.
classitems.name: trim

params.name: str
params.description: A string or an array of strings to be trimmed

return.description: Returns the input in a trimmed way

classitems.description: Draws an ellipse (oval) in the display window. An ellipse with an equal width and height is a circle. The first two parameters set the location, the third sets the width, and the fourth sets the height.
classitems.name: ellipse

return.description: New oval (n.b. in Adobe Scripting the corresponding type is Oval, not Ellipse)

classitems.description: Draws a line (a direct path between two points) to the page.
classitems.name: line

classitems.description: Draws a rectangle to the page.
classitems.name: rect

classitems.description:
The function calculates the geometric bounds of any given object.
In case the object is any kind of text, then additional typographic information baseline and xHeight are calculated
classitems.name: bounds

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to calculate the geometric bounds

return.description: Geometric bounds object with these properties: width, height, left, right, top, bottom and for text: baseline, xHeight

classitems.description:
Modifies the location from which rectangles draw. The default mode is 
rectMode(CORNER), which specifies the location to be the upper left 
corner of the shape and uses the third and fourth parameters of rect() 
to specify the width and height. The syntax rectMode(CORNERS) uses the 
first and second parameters of rect() to set the location of one corner 
and uses the third and fourth parameters to set the opposite corner. 
The syntax rectMode(CENTER) draws the image from its center point and 
uses the third and forth parameters of rect() to specify the image's 
width and height. The syntax rectMode(RADIUS) draws the image from its 
center point and uses the third and forth parameters of rect() to specify 
half of the image's width and height. The parameter must be written in 
"ALL CAPS".
classitems.name: rectMode

params.name: mode
params.description: Either b.CORNER, b.CORNERS, b.CENTER, or b.RADIUS

classitems.description:
The origin of the ellipse is modified by the ellipseMode() function. 
The default configuration is ellipseMode(CENTER), which specifies the 
location of the ellipse as the center of the shape. The RADIUS mode is 
the same, but the width and height parameters to ellipse() specify the 
radius of the ellipse, rather than the diameter. The CORNER mode draws 
the shape from the upper-left corner of its bounding box. The CORNERS 
mode uses the four parameters to ellipse() to set two opposing corners 
of the ellipse's bounding box. The parameter must be written in "ALL CAPS".
classitems.name: ellipseMode

params.name: mode
params.description: Either b.CENTER, b.RADIUS, b.CORNER, or b.CORNERS

classitems.description:
Sets the width of the stroke used for lines and the border 
around shapes.
classitems.name: strokeWeight

classitems.description: Returns the object style with the given name. If the style does not exist it gets created.
classitems.name: objectStyle

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object style to return.

classitems.description: Sets the color used to fill shapes.
classitems.name: fill

params.name: fillColor
params.description: Accepts a Color/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

classitems.description:
Disables filling geometry. If both noStroke() and noFill() are called, 
newly drawn shapes will be invisible.
classitems.name: noFill

classitems.description: Sets the color used to draw lines and borders around shapes.
classitems.name: stroke

params.name: strokeColor
params.description: Accepts a Color/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

classitems.description:
Disables drawing the stroke (outline). If both noStroke() and noFill() 
are called, nothing will be drawn to the screen.
classitems.name: noStroke

classitems.description: Sets the tint of the color used to fill shapes.
classitems.name: fillTint

classitems.description: Sets the tint of the color used to draw lines and borders around shapes.
classitems.name: strokeTint

classitems.description: Creates a new RGB or CMYK color and adds the new color to the document, or gets a color by name from the document
classitems.name: color

params.name: Get
params.description: color: the color name. Create new color: R,G,B,name or C,M,Y,K,name or Grey,name. Name is always optional

classitems.description:
Calculates a color or colors between two color at a specific increment. 
The amt parameter is the amount to interpolate between the two values where 0.0 equal to the first point, 0.1 is very near the first point, 0.5 is half-way in between, etc.
N.B.: Both color must be either CMYK or RGB.
classitems.name: lerpColor

params.name: amt
params.description: The Amount to interpolate between the two colors

classitems.description:
Creates a text frame on the current layer on the current page in the current document. 
The text frame gets created in the position specified by the x and y parameters.
The default document font will be used unless a font is set with the textFont() function. 
The default document font size will be used unless a font size is set with the textSize() function. 
Change the color of the text with the fill() function.
The text displays in relation to the textAlign() and textYAlign() functions. 
The width and height parameters define a rectangular area.
classitems.name: text

params.name: txt
params.description: The text content to set in the text frame.

classitems.description:
Sets text properties to the given item. If the item is not an instance the text property can be set to,
the property gets set to the direct descendants of the given item, e.g. all stories of a given document.

If no value is given and the given property is a string, the function acts as a getter and returns the
corresponding value(s) in an array. This can either be an array containing the value of the concrete item
(e.g. character) the values of the item's descendants (e.g. paragraphs of given text frame).
classitems.name: typo

params.name: item
params.description: The object to apply the property to.

params.name: property
params.description:
The text property name of an object of key/value property/value pairs.
                                  If property is a string and no value is given, the function acts as getter.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to apply to the property.

return.description:
The property value(s) if the function acts as getter or the items the property
                             was assigned to.

classitems.description: Returns the current font and sets it if argument fontName is given.
classitems.name: textFont

params.name: fontName
params.description: The name of the font to set e.g. Helvetica

return.description: The name of the current font

classitems.description: Returns the current font size in points and sets it if argument pointSize is given.
classitems.name: textSize

params.name: pointSize
params.description: The size in points to set.

classitems.description: Sets the current horizontal and vertical text alignment.
classitems.name: textAlign

params.name: align
params.description:
The horizontal text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign Justification enum values:
                          Justification.AWAY_FROM_BINDING_SIDE
                          Justification.CENTER_ALIGN
                          Justification.CENTER_JUSTIFIED
                          Justification.FULLY_JUSTIFIED
                          Justification.LEFT_ALIGN
                          Justification.RIGHT_ALIGN
                          Justification.RIGHT_JUSTIFIED
                          Justification.TO_BINDING_SIDE

params.name: yAlign
params.description:
The vertical text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign VerticalJustification enum values:
                          VerticalJustification.BOTTOM_ALIGN
                          VerticalJustification.CENTER_ALIGN
                          VerticalJustification.JUSTIFY_ALIGN
                          VerticalJustification.TOP_ALIGN

classitems.description: Returns the spacing between lines of text in units of points and sets it if argument leading is given.
classitems.name: textLeading

params.name: leading
params.description:
The spacing between lines of text in units of points or the default Indesign enum
                                  value Leading.AUTO.

classitems.description: Returns the current kerning and sets it if argument kerning is given.
classitems.name: textKerning

classitems.description: Returns the current tracking and sets it if argument tracking is given.
classitems.name: textTracking

classitems.description: Returns the character style with the given name. If the style does not exist it gets created.
classitems.name: characterStyle

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the character style to return.

classitems.description: Returns the paragraph style with the given name. If the style does not exist it gets created.
classitems.name: paragraphStyle

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the paragraph style to return.

classitems.description: Links the stories of two textframes to one story. Text of first textframe overflows to second one.
classitems.name: linkTextFrames

classitems.description:
Adds an image to the document. If the image argument is given as a string the image file  must be in the document's
data directory which is in the same directory where the document is saved in. The image argument can also be a File
instance which can be placed even before the document was saved.
The second argument can either be the x position of the frame to create or an instance of a rectangle,
oval or polygon to place the image in.
If x and y positions are given and width and height are not given, the frame's size gets set to the original image size.
classitems.name: image

params.name: img
params.description: The image file name in the document's data directory or a File instance

params.name: x
params.description: The x position on the current page or the item instance to place the image in

params.name: y
params.description: The y position on the current page. Ignored if x is not a number.

params.name: w
params.description: The width of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

params.name: h
params.description: The height of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

return.description: The item instance the image was placed in.

classitems.description:
Transforms position and size of an image.
The image fit options are always "contentToFrame".
classitems.name: transformImage

classitems.description:
Modifies the location from which images draw. The default mode is imageMode(CORNER), which specifies the location to be the upper left corner and uses the fourth and fifth parameters of image() to set the image's width and height. The syntax imageMode(CORNERS) uses the second and third parameters of image() to set the location of one corner of the image and uses the fourth and fifth parameters to set the opposite corner. Use imageMode(CENTER) to draw images centered at the given x and y position.
If no parameter is passed the currently set mode is returned as String.
classitems.name: imageMode

classitems.description: Constructor of Vector, can be two- or three-dimensional.
classitems.name: Vector

classitems.description:
Calculates the Euclidean distance between two points (considering a point as a vector object).
Is meant to be called "static" i.e. Vector.dist(v1, v2);
classitems.name: dist

classitems.description:
Calculates the dot product of two vectors.
Is meant to be called "static" i.e. Vector.dot(v1, v2);
classitems.name: dot

classitems.description:
Calculates the cross product of two vectors.
Is meant to be called "static" i.e. Vector.cross(v1, v2);
classitems.name: cross

classitems.description:
Calculates the angle between two vectors.
Is meant to be called "static" i.e. Vector.angleBetween(v1, v2);
classitems.name: angleBetween

classitems.description: Sets the x, y, and z component of the vector using three separate variables, the data from a PVector, or the values from a float array.
classitems.name: set

params.name: v
params.description: Either a vector, array or x component

classitems.description: Gets a copy of the vector, returns a Vector object.
classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Calculates the magnitude (length) of the vector and returns the result as a float
classitems.name: mag

classitems.description: Adds x, y, and z components to a vector, adds one vector to another.
classitems.name: add

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Substract x, y, and z components or a full vector from this vector
classitems.name: sub

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Multiplies this vector with x, y, and z components or another vector.
classitems.name: mult

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Divides this vector through x, y, and z components or another vector.
classitems.name: div

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Calculates the distance from this vector to another as x, y, and z components or full vector.
classitems.name: dist

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Calculates the dot product from this vector to another as x, y, and z components or full vector.
classitems.name: dot

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Calculates the cross product from this vector to another as x, y, and z components or full vector.
classitems.name: cross

params.name: v
params.description: Either a full vector or an x component

classitems.description: Normalizes the length of this vector to 1.
classitems.name: normalize

classitems.description: Normalizes the length of this vector to the given parameter.
classitems.name: limit

classitems.description: The 2D orientation (heading) of this vector in radian.
classitems.name: heading2D

classitems.description: Returns data about this vector as a string.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: The x, y and z components as a string.

classitems.description: Returns this vector as an array [x,y,z].
classitems.name: array

classitems.description: Returns items tagged with the given label in the InDesign Script Label pane (Window -> Utilities -> Script Label).
classitems.name: findByLabel

return.description: Array of concrete PageItem instances, e.g. TextFrame or SplineItem.

classitems.description: Returns the currently selected object(s)
classitems.name: selection

classitems.description:
Reads the contents of a file and creates a String array of its individual lines.
If the file is specified by name as String, it must be located in the document's data directory.
classitems.name: loadStrings

params.name: file
params.description: The text file name in the document's data directory or a File instance

return.description: Array of the individual lines in the given file.

classitems.description:
Writes an array of strings to a file, one line per string. This file is saved to the document's data directory.
If the given file exists it gets overridden.
classitems.name: saveStrings

params.name: file
params.description: The file name or a File instance

params.name: strings
params.description: The string array to be written

classitems.description: Exports the current document as PDF to the documents data folder. Please note, that export options default to the last used export settings.
todo: data folder is not created automatically
classitems.name: savePDF

params.name: file
params.description: The file name or a File instance

params.name: showOptions
params.description: Whether to show the export dialog

classitems.description: Positions a PageItem at the designated spot on the x axis. If no x argument is given the current x position is returned.
classitems.name: itemX

classitems.description: Positions a PageItem at the designated spot on the y axis. If no y argument is given the current y position is returned.
classitems.name: itemY

classitems.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given width. If width is not given as argument the current width is returned.
classitems.name: itemWidth

classitems.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given height. If height is not given as argument the current height is returned.
classitems.name: itemHeight

classitems.description: Moves the given PageItem to the given position. If x or y is not given as argument the current position is returned.
classitems.name: itemPosition

return.description: Returns an object with the fields x and y

classitems.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given size. If width or height is not given as argument the current size is returned.
classitems.name: itemSize

return.description: Returns an object with the fields width and height

classitems.description: Run the sketch! Has to be called in every sketch a the very end of the code.
classitems.name: go

classitems.description:
EXPERIMENTAL!

Causes basil to continuously execute the code within draw() when InDesign is idle.
#targetengine "loop"; must be at the very top in the script file.
If noLoop() is called, the code in draw() stops executing.
It is essential to call noLoop() or execute the script lib/stop.jsx when the script is finished!
The framerate property determines how often draw() is called per second, e.g. a framerate of 20 will 20times call draw() per second.
classitems.name: loop

params.name: framerate
params.description: The framerate per second, determines how often draw() is called per second.

classitems.description:
EXPERIMENTAL!

Stops basil from continuously executing the code within draw().
classitems.name: noLoop
